com.github.upthewaterspout.fates.core.states

Interface StateExplorer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Decider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DepthFirstExplorer, ErrorCapturingExplorer

    public interface StateExplorer
extends Decider
    An algorithm for exploring the space of possible decisions during a test run.

    The StateExplorationHarness will take this algorithm and use it as the Decider when executing a test. After the test is done, the StateExplorationHarness will call the done() method. The harness will then execute the test again, and the StateExplorer is expected to make new decisions the next time around.

    The harness will continue to execute the test until isCompletelyTested() returns true.

    It is helpful to implement this estimateIterations() method to estimate the remaining number of tests runs, but it is not required.

    See DecisionTree for a utility for keeping track of previously made decisions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void done()
      Indicate to the explorer that we have finished a complete test run.
      long estimateIterations()
      Estimate the number of iterations of the test that need to be performed
      boolean isCompletelyTested()
      Return true if testing should stop at this point, because all or enough states have been explored.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.github.upthewaterspout.fates.core.states.Decider

        decide

    • Method Detail

      • done

        void done()
        Indicate to the explorer that we have finished a complete test run. The explorer should reset itself to the initial state, making different choices on the next time through.

      • isCompletelyTested

        boolean isCompletelyTested()
        Return true if testing should stop at this point, because all or enough states have been explored.
        Returns:
        true if the test should stop

      • estimateIterations

        long estimateIterations()
        Estimate the number of iterations of the test that need to be performed
        Returns:
        estimated number of iterations
